Description: Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering, or a related discipline. A strong academic background is preferred.Experience: Previous experience in an administrative role, preferably in a quantitative or research-oriented environment, is beneficial.Administrative Skills: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in administrative tasks such as scheduling, invoicing, and documentation management.Analytical Thinking: Ability to think analytically and interpret quantitative data. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methodologies is a plus.Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with team members, clients, and vendors.Team Player: Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Willingness to learn and contribute to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.Time Management: Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple deadlines, and work efficiently under pressure.Technology Proficiency: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Familiarity with survey software, data management systems, and statistical software is a plus.Job Details
